ovdesc.p: The file contains the information that is carried by the Batch Header type record, that is the one with the file type indicator '5'.

This includes the date on which the payment was requested to be settled, identifies the company and also the descripition of all the credit and debit entries that are included in the file being processed.

For the incoming entries, the table is updated by retreiving details from the incoming file and the same is used to construct the NACHA compliant output file in case of outward entries and returned entries.

desc.p: The key of this application is formed from the ACH.FILE id followed by the sequence number of the batch pertaining to the particular file being processed.
For example, if a file has three batch under it, the IDs will be formed as the < FILE.ID >.1 , < FILE.ID > .2 , < FILE.ID > .3
Mandatory field, Maximum of 1 character, as the table carries BATCH header record, the value is always 5.
Identifies the type of the record. As per the NACHA format, the file structure has different types of records which are identified by the codes as given below.
Mandatory field, Maximum of 1 character, as the table carries BATCH header record, the value is always 5.
The service class code field helps in identifying the type of the entries in the batch.
Denotes the name of the company which is routing the transaction.
This field is used for internal use of the bank.
Carries the code of the company which is routing the transaction.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
The field carries the standard entry class code type which uniquely identifies the class of the ACH transactions made.
The following are the various SEC codes
These are picked up from the EB.LOOKUP table and hence needs an entry in the same.
The field gives the description of the transaction to be used to print on the bank statement at the receiver's end.
The date chosen by the company to be displayed on the statements that can be used for identifying the transactions.
The effective date on which the transactions are to be posted to the receivers' accounts.
Date on which the transactions for the batch are to be settled

The originator status code is always given a value of 1.</p
This identifies LaSalle/Standard Federal as a depository financial institution, as per the rules of ACH
Validation Rules:
Maximum of 1 character
Carries the Routing number or the ABA number of the Originating financial institution.
Usually carries the LaSalle's routing number 07100050 or the Standard Federal's routing number 07200080.
Indicates the sequence of the batch record belonging to the file being processed.
The first batch record is given the value of 1, followed by 2,3 etc sequentially.
Date on which the transaction will be created in T24
This field identifies the origin that is the immediate sender of the incoming file.
Denotes the record type code of the Batch trailer. This is defaulted to '8'.
The service class code in the batch trailer helps in identifying the type of the entries in the batch.
200 - ACH Entries Mixed Debits and Credits
Provides the total number of entries / addenda records processed within the batch.
Total of all positions 4-11 on each 6 record (Detail). Only use the final 10 positions in the entry
This field gives the total debit amount of all the entries, belonging to the batch being processed, in dollars.
This field gives the total credit amount of all the entries, belonging to the batch being processed, in dollars.
The company code to be specified in the Trailer of the Batch record. This has to match with the code given in the Batch header.
Carries the Routing number or the ABA number of the Originating financial institution in the batch trailer record.
Usually carries the LaSalle's routing number 07100050 or the Standard Federal's routing number 07200080.
Indicates the sequence of the batch record belonging to the file being processed to be mentioned in the trailer record.
The first batch record is given the value of 1, followed by 2,3 etc sequentially.
This field is not used currently.
This field is not used currently.
This field is not used currently.
Denotes the country in which the entry is to be received.
The country is reprensented by a two charactered code, approved by the International Organisation for Standardization (ISO).
Two character code, must be available in the COUNTRY table.
The field indicates the currency in which the originator creates the transaction.
Must be a valid currrency available on the CURRENCY table
The field indicates the currency in which the entry is to be received.
Must be a valid currrency available on the CURRENCY table
Carries the ID of the ACH.FILE records, that carry details of the record with file type indicator '1' , that is to the file header to which the batch being processed belongs to.
Must be a valid ACH.FILE record
This field gives the calculated total debit amount of all the entries belonging to the batch being processed.
This field gives the calculated total credit amount of all the entries belonging to the batch being processed.
This field is not used currently.
This field helps in identifying the foreign exchange conversion methodology applied to an IAT entry.
A two charactered code indicates the methodology as below
Field consists for the ISO Country code of the destination
ID of Originator of the file
This field contains the currency code, approved by ISO to identify the currency denomination in which the entry was first originated.
This field contains the currency code, approved by ISO to identify the currency denomination in which the entry is to be received.
Holds the name of the file from which the incoming entries were received.
This is helpful in tracing the entries in case of an inquiry.
